results.title: Adelaide celebrations
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Lesley Hammond, Terry Jennings and Penny Chapman
results.brief_description: Excerpts from the many theatre arts and crafts on display at Adelaide Festival time. An interesting study of Adelaide at the time of its biennial festival of the arts, in 1976.

results.title: Adelaide advances
results.creator_credit: Auster Films, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Carl Kayser
results.brief_description: A description of the city and suburbs of Adelaide since foundation. A father is driving his son to one of the research laboratories and as they approach the city, he tells the boy of local industries and the contributions made to the South Australian economy by the Agricultural Research Institute. Includes scenes of the landmarks of the city and a visit to the Onkaparinga Racecourse. Sponsored by the Australian News & Information Bureau and narrated by David Low.

results.title: Adelaide's Christmas pageant
results.creator_credit: South Australian Government Tourist Bureau and G Shepherd
results.brief_description: Presents an annual Adelaide folk event - the Christmas pageant - through the eyes of a small boy. The procession winds its way through crowds of people, with no commentary, only the sounds of Adelaide enjoying the occasion. The pageant is sponsored and presented by a department store but without direct advertising.

results.title: Addition with mixed numerals
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films, General Learning Corporation and Harry D Ruderman
results.brief_description: Big John, the coal miner, has trouble adding mixed numbers. Fortunately, Big John, with the aid of his parrot, learns to organise the tallies by adding the whole numbers and the fractional parts.

results.title: Addition and subtraction (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
A teaching situation is presented showing children using apparatus to partition a set of seven objects and how their findings are recorded on a wall chart. Shows how to read a mathematical sentence

results.title: Addio tradizione
results.creator_credit: Open Window Productions, South Australian Film Corporation and Anna Louise Sortini
results.brief_description: Childhood memories are recalled whilst Sylvanna (Marcella Russo), a housewife, ponders her adolescent years with migrant Italian parents in Australia. A series of moving images show the Italian customs experienced throughout her childhood and the growing tensions and difficulties in the family as she reaches puberty and the two cultures of differing family values clash.

results.title: Adding or removing refrigerent
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids, Frederick K Rockett and F.E. Brooker
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
A refrigeration training film providing instruction on checking a domestic refrigeration system for lack of refrigerant, adding refrigerant for leak testing, how to add refrigerant by weight, adding an unmeasured amount and how to remove a refrigerant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids, Frederick K Rockett and F.E. Brooker

results.title: Adaptive radiation: the mollusks
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Walker
results.brief_description: Illustrates the principles of adaptive radiation and shows how the typical molluscan characteristics are modified in each of the six classes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Adaptations of insects. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Shows the ways in which insects are adapted to their environments. Considers the functions of legs, mouths, breathing organs and camouflage in allowing the various insects to survive in the particular environments. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.
